intro: Gaultheria apoensis, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a species of shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by edible berries that are rich in tannins. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Gaultheria apoensis is often found in high-altitude forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
